title: MiF
author: MiF
content: In trading the number one enemy is our self emotions, many trader loss because they can't control thier emotions and it really affects thier decision making and sometimes it will become a reason for the big loss, in crypto we cannot be free from different emotions because everytime market condition is changing and it is really a high volatility market, i think experienced had a very big role on decision making, is this a reason why most of the newbie loss is it because they don't have enough of experience?

comments.author: crzy
comments.body: Experience can only be learn once you are able to go out of your comfort zone and start taking risk, with this newbies are more prone to error and losses because they are still trying the water, that's why its advisable to start small first and don't rush in the market.With your emotion, it can take you somewhere else its either it will bring you up or you'll be frustrated. Managing your emotion is not easy, if you can't handle yourself yet better not to do day trading. Controlling your emotion is the key for your success in trading, learn how to do this properly.

True, as newbies only have limited knowledge and no enough experiences before they start trading, so that put them into high risk of losing their capital. Controlling the emotions is the key, but you will never master it unless you are never exposed to the real trading scenario and that you only invest to gain profits and not to learn and master trading.

comments.author: Russlenat
comments.body: Quote from: MiF on March 23, 2023, 09:33:11 PMIn trading the number one enemy is our self emotions, many trader loss because they can't control thier emotions and it really affects thier decision making and sometimes it will become a reason for the big loss, in crypto we cannot be free from different emotions because everytime market condition is changing and it is really a high volatility market, i think experienced had a very big role on decision making, is this a reason why most of the newbie loss is it because they don't have enough of experience?  Controlling our emotions will always be hard as we are used that in everything we do, we always consider our own emotions. But in trading, the more you use your emotions, the bigger chances you’ll keep on losing. Most particularly if you lack the knowledge and experiences that you need as a trader. That’s the reason why new traders should never trade unless they are ready, mentally and emotionally. Otherwise, if they still insist to trade because of greed for profits, their money will just go into waste and end up losing them.

Self-emotion might be an enemy for you to consider but sometimes, that emotion saves our asses in trading in most cases.Emotions are human nature. It is always associated with our decision in trading. It's really tough to withstand every market condition and you can't just simply say to others that they need to control it. Even professional traders feel emotional when they lose. What matter there is, after those big losses that result in emotional stress, traders should learn to bounce back and learn from those mistakes.Building experience is really the key while being serious about doing trades.

Experience is a big factor so you will be an efficient and successful trader in the long term. Without experience, you will find it hard to succeed in trading and you will always find it difficult to control your emotions especially when you are chasing for bigger profits, or you want to recover some losses. That’s the reason why controlling one’s emotion is a big challenge in trading, that most of traders fail to achieve it.

comments.author: Oceat
comments.body: Well, basically you can't learn anything if you don't fail that's why failure is the greatest teacher and there's no success on your first try. You can only learn it all if you allow yourself to experience it due to constant trial and error. Trading isn't that easy since you need to consider things that would hinder your ability to trade and that's controlling our emotions when trading.Generally, it's not just trading that will benefit you if you'll be able to control your emotions perhaps it will definitely make you choose the right path of choices when you control your emotions.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: MiF on March 23, 2023, 09:33:11 PMIn trading the number one enemy is our self emotions, many trader loss because they can't control thier emotions and it really affects thier decision making and sometimes it will become a reason for the big loss, in crypto we cannot be free from different emotions because everytime market condition is changing and it is really a high volatility market, i think experienced had a very big role on decision making, is this a reason why most of the newbie loss is it because they don't have enough of experience? Yes, that's exactly one of the main reasons why newbies are losing with their first trades. In all aspects that relate to risk-taking, every newbie is bound to lose at their start because they don't know how to plan the market yet. But once they gain experience, that's where they'll able to learn the lessons and manage to plan their next move on how they'll respond to the first failures that they've made. Those that aren't discouraged are the ones that continue and learn a lot. And they'll pursue trading because this is a market that they'll continue to thrive in because there's the opportunity. But then, even if they gain experience, soon they'll also realize that there are only a few percentages of winners in this market if it's about day trading.

comments.author: Unbunplease
comments.body: The most important thing is to find the strength to continue after the first failure. This requires a certain psychological stability. And also it is necessary to determine the right options to continue, so as not to make new and more serious mistakes.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: When you fail to manage your emotions, you fail completely in trading. Emotions have a significant impact on trading and can influence your decision-making process, which in turn influences your trading. Being able to control your emotions is also related to how well prepared you were before entering the market, as well as your ability to maintain a positive attitude or mindset regarding the outcome of a trade. You don't fail once or twice and then give up; you have to keep trying until you get it right. If your emotions get in the way, you won't get anywhere.

You should separate emotions from trading. Best example is chasing loses, it's very bad, especially if you want to chase that loss in just short period time or in just few trades.

comments.author: Sebas.tian
comments.body: Experience is the best teacher, once you experienced failure in your crypto trading in the past, it help you to know some of the things that made you failed and how to control yourself not to experience the same thing than to maintain some of the things that will give you success in the future. Many traders don't purchase Bitcoin when the price is high in the market, because they have experienced something that is not favourable that made them to change their decision to purchase Bitcoin when the price is low in the market. I don't think, emotions will control me to sell coins in the wrong period because I have learned from my experience never to be an hurry to sell without Carry out personal research.

comments.body: Quote from: MiF on March 23, 2023, 09:33:11 PMIn trading the number one enemy is our self emotions, many trader loss because they can't control thier emotions and it really affects thier decision making and sometimes it will become a reason for the big loss, in crypto we cannot be free from different emotions because everytime market condition is changing and it is really a high volatility market, i think experienced had a very big role on decision making, is this a reason why most of the newbie loss is it because they don't have enough of experience? A lack of self-control and experience are without a doubt two of the most important causes why traders in general lose their money to other market participants.But they are not the only ones, taking risks that are too high, lack of money management skills or not having a complete trading strategy are also important reasons why this happens, and with this in mind you need to concentrate on improving on all of those aspects, because a single moment of weakness can be enough to produce massive losses and you need to reduce the chances of this happening to you as much as possible by trying to improve your overall skill as a trader and not just a small number of skills and leave a glaring weakness on your ability to trade the markets.

comments.body: Quote from: MiF on March 23, 2023, 09:33:11 PMIn trading the number one enemy is our self emotions, many trader loss because they can't control thier emotions and it really affects thier decision making and sometimes it will become a reason for the big loss, in crypto we cannot be free from different emotions because everytime market condition is changing and it is really a high volatility market, i think experienced had a very big role on decision making, is this a reason why most of the newbie loss is it because they don't have enough of experience? The more experience you have, the better you control your emotions so to answer your question, it's yes.When I was a newbie in trading, there was also a time where I got FOMO'ed, and because of that I lost a half of my capital. I learned from that mistake of mine, but that wasn't enough learnings from me because I did it again the second time. I got FOMO'ed again and lost more than half of my initial capital. From that, I learned from it because I already experienced losing in trading. Though I can't say that I'm not experiencing any losses in trading, I can say that currently, I'm profiting more than losing in trading, and I'm not doing the same mistakes that I did again.Experience really is a huge thing when it comes to trading because from that, you will learn and you will adjust to it. If you made mistake, you will adjust base on what happened to you. You will not learn if you didn't experienced it. Maybe there are some traders who for some reasons, traded very well since they started, but most of the newbies really tend to lose their money as they start, and one reasons is their emotions.
